snippet: Many doubt that any successor will be as adept at fostering support, raising the question of what will become of President Hugo Chávez’s movement without him.
abstract: Venezuela's Socialist revolution is threatened by Pres Hugo Chavez's fight with cancer; Chavez makes virtually all major government decisions and bullies both allies and opponents to keep them in line, and many doubt that any successor will be as adept at fostering support amid nation's many problems.

byline.contributor: María Iguarán contributed reporting from Cumaná, Venezuela, and Andrew Rosati from Caracas.

lead_paragraph: Many doubt that any successor will be as adept at fostering support, raising the question of what will become of President Hugo Chávez’s movement without him.

headline.seo: Hugo Chavez’s Movement Threatened by His Health
headline.main: Of Many Woes, One Man’s Illness Threatens Venezuela’s Revolution
headline.print_headline: Of Many Woes, One Man’s Illness Threatens Venezuela’s Revolution
